text: Paul, a servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ, for the sake of the faith of God’s elect and the knowledge of the truth that is in accordance with godliness,
speaker: Narrator

text: in the hope of eternal life that God, who never lies, promised before the ages began—
speaker: Narrator

text: in due time he revealed his word through the proclamation with which I have been entrusted by the command of God our Savior,
speaker: Narrator

text:
To Titus, my true child in the faith we share:
Grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Savior.
speaker: Narrator

text: I left you behind in Crete for this reason, so that you should put in order what remained to be done and should appoint elders in every town, as I directed you:
speaker: Narrator

text: someone who is blameless, married only once, whose children are believers, not accused of debauchery and not rebellious.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a bishop, as God’s steward, must be blameless; he must not be arrogant or quick-tempered or addicted to wine or violent or greedy for gain,
speaker: Narrator

text: but he must be hospitable, a lover of goodness, self-controlled, upright, devout, and restrained,
speaker: Narrator

text: holding tightly to the trustworthy word of the teaching, so that he may be able both to exhort with sound instruction and to refute those who contradict it.
speaker: Narrator

text: There are also many rebellious people, idle talkers and deceivers, especially those of the circumcision;
speaker: Narrator

text: they must be silenced, since they are upsetting whole families by teaching for sordid gain what it is not right to teach.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It was one of them, their very own prophet, who said,
“Cretans are always liars, vicious brutes, lazy gluttons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: That testimony is true. For this reason rebuke them sharply, so that they may become sound in the faith,
speaker: Narrator

text: not paying attention to Jewish myths or to commandments of those who reject the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: To the pure all things are pure, but to the corrupt and unbelieving nothing is pure; their very minds and consciences are corrupted.
speaker: Narrator

text: They profess to know God, but they deny him by their actions; they are detestable, disobedient, unfit for any good work.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for you, teach what is consistent with sound instruction.
speaker: Narrator

text: Tell the older men to be temperate, serious, self-controlled, and sound in faith, in love, and in endurance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise, tell the older women to be reverent in behavior, not to be slanderers or enslaved to much wine; they are to teach what is good,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that they may encourage the young women to love their husbands, to love their children,
speaker: Narrator

text: to be self-controlled, chaste, good managers of the household, kind, submissive to their husbands, so that the word of God may not be discredited.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise, urge the younger men to be self-controlled
speaker: Narrator

text: in all things, offering yourself as a model of good works and in your teaching offering integrity, gravity,
speaker: Narrator

text: and sound speech that cannot be censured; then any opponent will be put to shame, having nothing evil to say of us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Urge slaves to be submissive to their masters in everything, to be pleasing, not talking back,
speaker: Narrator

text: not stealing, but showing complete and perfect fidelity, so that in everything they may be an ornament to the teaching of God our Savior.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation to all,
speaker: Narrator

text: training us to renounce impiety and worldly passions and in the present age to live lives that are self-controlled, upright, and godly,
speaker: Narrator

text: while we wait for the blessed hope and the manifestation of the glory of our great God and Savior, Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: He it is who gave himself for us that he might redeem us from all iniquity and purify for himself a people of his own who are zealous for good deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text: Declare these things; exhort and reprove with all authority. Let no one look down on you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remind them to be subject to rulers and authorities, to be obedient, to be ready for every good work,
speaker: Narrator

text: to speak evil of no one, to avoid quarreling, to be gentle, and to show every courtesy to everyone.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we ourselves were once foolish, disobedient, led astray, slaves to various passions and pleasures, passing our days in malice and envy, despicable, hating one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the goodness and loving kindness of God our Savior appeared,
speaker: Narrator

text: he saved us, not because of any works of righteousness that we had done, but according to his mercy, through the water of rebirth and renewal by the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: This Spirit he poured out on us richly through Jesus Christ our Savior,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that, having been justified by his grace, we might become heirs according to the hope of eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The saying is sure.
I desire that you insist on these things, so that those who have come to believe in God may be careful to devote themselves to good works; these things are excellent and profitable to everyone.
speaker: Narrator

text: But avoid stupid controversies, genealogies, dissensions, and quarrels about the law, for they are unprofitable and worthless.
speaker: Narrator

text: After a first and second admonition, have nothing more to do with anyone who causes divisions,
speaker: Narrator

text: since you know that such a person is perverted and sinful, being self-condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I send Artemas to you, or Tychicus, do your best to come to me at Nicopolis, for I have decided to spend the winter there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Make every effort to send Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their way, and see that they lack nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: And let people learn to devote themselves to good works in order to meet urgent needs, so that they may not be unproductive.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All who are with me send greetings to you. Greet those who love us in the faith.
Grace be with all of you.
speaker: Narrator
